description.narrative: By 2020, adolescents and youth have more opportunities to participate in local development and influence decision making., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Empowerment (Covid), Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescent Health And Nutrition (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, statutory needs based services to disadvantaged families are in place to realize the right of the child to live in caring, protective and resilient family environments.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Armenia (Social Protection and Child Poverty)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Armenia: Final Evaluation of Mitigating Social Consequences of the Labour Migration and Maximising the Migrants’ Involvement in Local Development Project
Armenia 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, adolescents and youth have more opportunities to participate in local development and influence decision making.

description.narrative: UNICEF adolescent programming expanded significantly in 2019. A total of 3409 adolescent girls and boys went through 21st Century skills, civic engagement, IT and entrepreneurial trainings, building their capacities to contribute to positive change in their communities and the country. 2558 youth responded to the CRC@30Petition. Efforts were made to ensure adolescent girls participation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of adolescents reached through UNICEF adolescent participation (ADAP) programmes (disaggregated by age and sex)

baseline.value: 0 adolescents participating, as there are no UNICEF adolescent participation programmes

target.value: 2020:At least 3000 of adolescent girls and boys reached through UNICEF ADAP programmes

title.narrative: Number of adolescent girls and boys who completed a skills development program

baseline.value: 0 adolescents participating, as there are no UNICEF adolescent participation programmes

target.value: 2020:300 adolescent girls and boys participated in skill development programmes through 6 rounds of UpShift programmes in 4 regions

title.narrative: Number of key events organised on climate action with adolescent participation and leadership.

target.value: 2020:At least one national event held in 2020.

title.narrative: Number of interactive, context-specific, gender-sensitive and age-appropriate climate change education teaching manuals/modules, training packages, and learning materials developed.
KAPB study conducted among adolescents and community population of target communities.

target.value: 2020:KAPB conducted and finalized to inform programme interventions.

title.narrative: Existence of a National Strategy on Youth which includes considerations relevant for adolescents

actual.value: 2019:New Government reviewed Draft National Strategy on Youth, however the revision process is still ongoing.
